attributes.action: ignore calls for reparations to Iraqi civilians, mistreated by U.K. forces, not to be paid until the Japanese government has formally apologised for the treatment of Allied POWs in World War II
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background: This is something a recent petition has called for. While not wishing to minimise the suffering of the POWs the Iraqi civilians are hardly responsible for it, and neither do they have any control over what the Japanese government does, so why should reparations for THEIR suffering be delayed?  Two wrongs don't make a right; and the suffering of the Iraqi civilians is no less important than that of the Allied POWs.
